CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, page 1, reads: "New Detective - Mayor David L. Lawrence congratulates Edward W. Bailey of the 13th Ward, who was promoted to city detective after serving 15 months as sergeant at East Liberty Police Station. Detective Bailey holds his youngest daughter, Linda, while his wife, Mrs. Merle Bailey, second from left, stands behind another daughter, Gayle. Homewood's ward chairwoman, Mrs. Sarah Kirk, right, who backed Bailey, also looks on. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence shaking hands with police detective Edward W. Bailey, holding daughter, Linda Bailey, his wife, Merle Bailey, rests her hand on daughter, Gayle Bailey, with Homewood's ward chairwoman, Sarah Kirk, gathered in the Office of the Mayor at the City County Building
